1512.content:
After what seemed like hours in another agonizingly boring day at school, you quickly retreated to your living room, not even bothering to greet your parents. You were just far too exhausted to even wave at them. Collapsing on the couch, you grabbed the remote, switching on the TV. Now you finally had the chance to watch your favorite show, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in peace. Despite how weird your parents thought it was for a sixteen year-old girl like you to watch a show geared towards young boys, you couldn't help but love it.

It also concerned your parents that you didn't have much of a social life outside of the internet, and said internet social life revolved around this particular show. They weren't sure yet, but this seemed like an unhealthy obsession. You merely rolled your eyes whenever they mentioned your 'problem'. It's not like you needed to make a lot of friends, right? Right.

Ugh, parents. What did they know? But you put any thoughts of your parents aside, and focused on how rad this show was...

Until your mom pulled her usual bullshit, and turned off your TV.

"Mom!" You cried. "What the frick frack did you do that for?!"

Your mother simply scoffed in response. You half-expected her to wag her finger at you in a scolding manner, but she did not.

"I think this obsession of yours has gone too far, honey. You need to go outside, make some friends, and get some fresh air! There's more to life than watching a cartoon about big ninja frogs--"

"Turtles, mom."

"Turtles. But do you understand what I'm getting at?"

"Yeah." You responded with a huff, crossing your arms. "And it's dumb. Making friends is lame, and fresh air is so overrated."

You mother frowned in response, sighing sadly as she looked at you, concern clear in her eyes. She bit her lip, as if she was going to tell you that your dog just got hit by a car...Which actually wasn't what she was going to say, of course. Your family didn't even own a dog.

"Honey..." She began. "You can't do this anymore. You always stay in front of the TV like a zombie, or lock yourself up in your room all day!"

"Uh huh. Mom...Can I go back to watching my show now?" You asked, uninterested in whatever she was about to say. Your mother sighed, leaving you in peace as she walked away. You took this chance to pick up the remote to turn on the TV, groaning as you realized that the power button wasn't working for some reason. "Stupid thing..." You mumbled, tossing the remote to the side. You got up from your seat to inspect the TV, cringing as it suddenly switched on without warning, the loud sound of screeching static invading your ears.

That was the last thing you remembered before blacking out.

Your eyes suddenly fluttered open, your vision returning. As everything slowly became less foggy, you couldn't help but think that this place looked...familiar somehow. But why was everything so huge?

"Ungh...I've gotta be on drugs or something..."

Suddenly, something large was coming your way. What was it?
1512.title: Cuz you are a girl and you're a special individual

15122.content:
It wasn't until now that you realized something. You were laying on a greasy, cheesy, and delicious smelling pizza! You made a slight face of disgust, standing up on the slice of food. As much as you liked pizza, laying on it was probably one of the grossest things you've ever done. You lifted your head to view the figure approaching you, instantly freaking out as you noticed a very important detail about this stranger. It had been Michelangelo, of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles!

         You weren't exactly sure about how you should take this. Should you be amazed? Scared? Or jumping for joy? You sort of felt a combination of all of those, feeling excited and inspired from the discovery that your heroes were real, but at the same time, pretty spooked. After all, fiction was fiction, and this kind of stuff just didn't happen...

However, your thoughts were cut off as the slice you were on was suddenly scooped up, making you clutch onto the greasy cheese for dear life as you were slowly being brought to...Mikey's mouth! You covered your nose and mouth at the smell of Mikey's terrible breath, panicking. 'Oh my god whatdoIdowhatdoIdowhatdoIdo?!' You thought to yourself, rather frantically. After all, you were going to get EATEN! And being digested didn't sound very fun. Trying to stay calm, an idea came to your mind. Maybe if you screamed loud enough, Mikey would hear you, and you wouldn't get eaten! It was worth a shot at least, right?

You took a deep breath, and practically screamed your lungs out.

151221.content:
Mikey nearly dropped the slice of pizza when he heard your scream, staring at the slice he was about to eat. His bright blue eyes blinked in confusion as they looked down at you with curiosity. "Whoa..." Without warning, he picked you up with two of his large fingers, holding you by the back of your shirt. "Awwww, you look so cute! Why are you so small, dude--I mean, dudette?" The mutant turtle asked, watching you squirm around in his grip.

         "P-please put me down!" You squeaked, your fear of heights getting the best of you(especially in your now tiny form). Mikey gives you an apologetic look before gently setting you down near the pizza box. He watched you intently, rather fascinated and entertained by your small body. Trying to ignore how uncomfortable it was to be stared at by a giant, you figured should answer Mikey's question. Or try to, anyway.

         'I um...I don't know." You answered sheepishly. "I just kind of...popped up here, and now I'm the size of an ant!" You were about to say that you were watching Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles on your TV, but you figured it'd be best to keep that to yourself. Who knows what could happen if The Turtles found out they were fictional! Even if you weren't sure how this dimension hopping business worked, it seemed like a good idea to avoiding possibly breaking the universe by telling them such information.

"But anyway..." You started. "I need to find a way to get back home...or maybe to a normal size, at least." You cringed at the thought of staying like this forever. Despite how lame and completely dull your life could be sometimes, you had to admit, you were feeling a little homesick right now.

Mikey frowned at that, looking quite disappointed as he patted your little head with his large index finger. The poor turtle looked like a kicked puppy, making guilt build up inside of you. Why did he have to be so darn innocent and cute?

"Awwww...Do you really have to go?" He whined, giving you his famous puppy eyes. Having watched the show, you knew that Mikey really wanted to make more human friends, so he was probably pretty torn up about you having to go. Snapping out of his sad state, Mikey stopped to think for a moment, getting an idea.
